page.title: 14LANDSCAPE AROUND CALLANDER
page.content: The landscape of this area is flat looking south to the rich low lying farmland of the Forth Valley.To the East,the ground shows signs of the remains of {glaciation.}To the west and north are the lochs and mountains of the {Highlands.} The Red Bridge crosses the river where the old {fording place}used to be.It joined thevillages of Kirkton and Bridgend. Just along the river is white painted Waterside House,and beside the bridge is the old Callander Cemetery. The sundial beside the footbridge dates from 1753 and has an interesting inscription.St.Brides Church,now Callander Kirk dated 1861 is worth a visit for its beautiful interior. To the west is Samson's Putting Stone ,the result of glaciation.
